About The Project

The Metadata Timeline Generator is designed to simplify one of the most critical tasks in digital forensics: timeline analysis. By processing files, the tool extracts standard file system metadata (timestamps, size, type) and, where possible, embedded data like EXIF information from images. This data is then stored in a local SQLite database for persistence and fast querying.

The frontend, built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, provides a user-friendly interface to upload files and view the results. For folders, you get a comprehensive dashboard view with a file type breakdown and a detailed table. For individual files, you get a focused timeline view, making it easy to see the sequence of events. The backend is powered by Python and the Flask micro-framework, ensuring a lightweight yet powerful server-side operation.
